name: Positive Money Europe
goal:
Positive Money Europe campaigns for making the European Central Bank and Eurozone institutions contribute to a more fair, democratic and sustainable economy.

Positive Money Europe was established in February 2019 by Positive Money UK, a nonprofit organisation created in 2010 and based in London.

Since 2010, Positive Money’s core focus has been to reform the financial system in the UK. In 2015, Positive Money UK developed EU advocacy work, and in 2016 we opened a small Brussels-based office. In February 2019, we established a Positive Money Europe as a separate legal entity (ASBL) which focuses on the EU.


Our main goals are:

• Aligning the ECB with the EU’s sustainability and climate change mitigation goals
•  Making Eurozone institutions and the ECB more democratic and accountable
• Preventing and coping with the next financial crisis
• Reducing wealth inequality
• Reducing the burden of debt on society
• Modernizing payment systems

Our activities mainly cover research and campaigns about the European Central Bank policies and engaging with the European Parliament in the context of the Monetary Dialogue and the appointments to the ECB's Executive Board.
interests: Banking and financial services, Climate Action, Economy, finance and the euro
